title: Radio Station Cleared After Bad Words Played by Mistake
summary: A radio station called Horizon Radio had a problem when someone else took over their broadcast and played bad words on a loop for 26 minutes. This happened in Milton Keynes during an evening show at 6 PM, when kids might be listening. Ofcom, the group that checks radio stations, looked into it. Horizon Radio tried many times to stop the bad words and said sorry to listeners. Ofcom decided that Horizon Radio did everything they could to fix the mistake and did not get in trouble. The station explained that the problem was caused by a company they work with, not by them. They quickly got their normal show back on the air.

background_read: Radio stations like Horizon Radio send out shows for people to listen to. Sometimes, mistakes happen, like when someone else takes over the broadcast. Ofcom is a group in the UK that watches over radio and TV to make sure they follow rules, especially to protect kids. When a station makes a mistake, they might say sorry and try to fix it quickly. This story shows how a station handled a problem with bad words being played by accident.
